definition: to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Example: Enjoy it! You can't have too much of a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 見好就收吧你不可能太走運了。

sentences.english: I won't interference you from now on !
I decided the best thing to do was to graciously bow out.
sentences.chinese: 於是我做了一個最佳的決定，那就是優雅地見好就收。

sentences.english: He courted a lot, but never boiled over, just simmered.
sentences.chinese: 他曾追求過很多女孩，但從不過熱，見好就收。

sentences.english: Almost on the line now, just leave.
sentences.chinese: 差不多就行吧，見好就收。

sentences.english: You can't have too much of a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 見好就收吧，你不可能太走運了。

definition: to have boundless prospects
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
debt of gratitude
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
reckless/extremely daring
it's nothing personal (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
ability/skill
